item.title: Need help with editing WikiStyle (SMF theme)
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

By default, the theme ads ‘Sort=subject’ to the board links making it sort the board in abc order. I only want the board ids 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7 to sort by subject. I tried, but i suck at php. I would appreciate it if somebody changed it for me or taught me how to change it.

Here is the code in which i need changed

[code]<?php
// Version: 1.1; BoardIndex

function template_main()
{
global $context, $settings, $options, $txt, $scripturl, $modSettings;

		 echo '<div id="masterdiv">';
		 $counter = 1;
/* Each category in categories is made up of:
	id, href, link, name, is_collapsed (is it collapsed?), can_collapse (is it okay if it is?),
	new (is it new?), collapse_href (href to collapse/expand), collapse_image (up/down iamge),
	and boards. (see below.) */
foreach ($context['categories'] as $category)
{
	echo '<div class="menutitle" onclick="SwitchMenu(\'sub'.$counter.'\')">', $category['name'] ,'</div>';
							 echo '<div class="submenu" id="sub'.$counter.'">';
		foreach ($category['boards'] as $board)
		{
			echo '<div class="maincat"><div class="header"><a href="', $board['href'], ';sort=subject" name="b', $board['id'], '">', $board['name'], '</a></div>
			<div class="description">', $board['description'],'</div></div>';
		}
		echo '</div><br /><br />';
	$counter++;
}
echo '</div>
';

}

?>[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with editing WikiStyle (SMF theme)
